Contact the Center
We would love to hear your feedback. Please fill out this quick
3min survey
for a chance to win a free Artist membership for a year, or a $50 gift card for 2025!
For any other inquiries please use the form below to contact the Leesburg Arts Center. We’ll get back to you!

City of Leesburg
,
United Arts of Central Florida
, and through sponsors and members, as well as in association with the
Leesburg Chamber of Commerce

Mon-Fri 10am-4pm   Sat-Sun 12n-4pm
429 W Magnolia St Leesburg FL 34748 352.365.0232 leesburgarts.com

Squarespace

Studio Artists
Art transforms lives at LAC, even for our accomplished professional resident artists, who make art in their own designated space within the Leesburg Arts Center. Studio Artists discover, explore and experiment with art techniques, tools and mediums to create new works with no interruptions or distractions in a space that is fueled by art all day long.
RESIDENT ARTIST
Margaret Everson
Margaret is the heart and soul of the Leesburg Arts Center. A mixed medium specialist, Ms. Everson is also a teacher, currently teaching the
Art U
and
Mobile Art Studio
programs at the Center.
Contact Margaret
RESIDENT ARTIST
Jackii Molsick, FWS
Watercolorist and mixed medium artist extraordinaire and
MUCH MORE
, the Art Center is proud to include this artist to our resident space.
A widely-exhibited painter and teacher, Jackii is a member of the Whiskey Painters, as well as past President of the Florida Watercolor Society.
Jackii’s webpage

The
ROTARY LEESBURG ARTS FESTIVAL
is
BACK
for 2026!
Application starts 8/23/2025 forthis year’s show.
LINK to ZAPPlication
We want to hear your thoughts
! Click the button to fill out a feedback survey for the Rotary Leesburg Art Festival 2025.

ROTARY Leesburg Arts Festival 2025 and Literary Festival

ICS
Tropic Arts Alliance
Monthly meeting every 3rd Saturday. All members are welcome!
The Tropic Arts Alliance is a Membership Group with a dedication to supporting the programs at the Leesburg Arts Center. To encourage openness, connection and fun around the arts, the TAA holds meetings, programs and events to ensure accountability and communication in preserving the legacy of art in Leesburg.

Jul
21
to Jul 24
Annual Art Center Clean-Out
Mon, Jul 21, 2025
10:00 AM
Thu, Jul 24, 2025
4:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
Summer camp, donations, and events, oh my!
Flex your organizing skills, and show the art center a little love during our annual clean out. This is the time we work through the list of projects that accumulate over the year to leave our community art center in tip top shape and functioning for another round of programs and events.
Contact claire@leesburgarts.com if you are interested in volunteering!
View Event →
Jul
19
Back to School Bash
Saturday, July 19, 2025
10:00 AM
12:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
The Hope Coalition is hosting their annual Back To School Bash for Leesburg Area students.
Let's come together as a community to support our educators and students! Donations will be accepted now through July 19th.
Want to volunteer?
We're looking for enthusiastic individuals to join our team and help us create an unforgettable event for our students! We need a few volunteers who can help pass out the supplies! Please
register
if you would like to serve.
The Venetian Center 1 Dozier Circle Leesburg, FL, 34748

Jun
27
2 Page Read-In and Sing-In
Friday, June 27, 2025
5:00 PM
7:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
With Drew Willard
Monthly Community Sharing!
Come and share 2 pages of your favorite book by reading aloud to others - who likewise have a favorite book to share. Musicians are invited to share 1 song, either original or artistic interpretations of covers. Reading aloud is a basic way for society to pass along the lore of its community, and to socialize the next generation. It transcends generational differences and offers public speaking experience with great personal benefits.
*When selecting your book/song, keep in mind that children may be present.
Non-member $10   Member $5
Sign-Up

Jun
27
2 Page Read-In and Sing-In
Friday, June 27, 2025
5:00 PM
7:00 PM
Google Calendar
ICS
With Drew Willard
Monthly Community Sharing!
Come and share 2 pages of your favorite book by reading aloud to others - who likewise have a favorite book to share. Musicians are invited to share 1 song, either original or artistic interpretations of covers. Reading aloud is a basic way for society to pass along the lore of its community, and to socialize the next generation. It transcends generational differences and offers public speaking experience with great personal benefits.
*When selecting your book/song, keep in mind that children may be present.
Non-member $10   Member $5

The LAC Difference
What is the
LAC Difference?
While many encourage creativity and celebrate how the arts contribute to wellness – at Leesburg Arts Center we
elevate
our students!
L
earn with professional artists/teachers
I
nspire with curriculum to progress students
F
ocus on individual achievement
T
each artists fundamental skills
U
tilize various art mediums
P
articipate in an arts community
Community Guidelines
Leesburg Arts Center is a COMMUNITY. In order to maintain our groups in good order, please read in full the Community Guidelines so we are all on the same page.
COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
Terms and Conditions
We want you to have ALL the information. Please don’t forget to read the Terms and Conditions to understand all the nitty-gritty of becoming a member.
TERMS AND CONDITIONS
